Character Creation
Section Description
Character Creator
This is the Character Creator where you can create a new character. You can navigate to the different aspects of character creation by selecting the tabs at the top of the page. Once you have finished character creation, select Finish to populate your character. Alternatively, you can select Exit to do character creation at another time. This is not recommended. You can always return to this page from Options on the main Character Sheet.
Origin Page
This is the Character Origin Page. Here you will set your character's name, their primary element, and ancestry. There are also some prebuild options to allow you to quickly build a character by choosing a Background and Archetype. These are optional choices to help steer your character into specific directions. You are always able to ignore these and just take on character creation from scratch.
Basics
Full Name
A character's full name. This is for self referential use.
Display Name
This is the name that is displayed when your character speaks.
 
Character Level
A trait that determines a character's general level of experience in the world.
 
Path
Path broadly describes a character's role in the game. A character's path determines how many techniques they can learn, it grants them new options as a character, and grants them additional ability score points.
 
Starting Job
Your job determines how your attributes grow and grant you unique and powerful techniques. In addition, your starting job will grant you three aptitudes. These aptitudes are often requirements to learn techniques.
 
Primary Affinity
Characters that are able to cast spells will have an elemental affinity that ties them to one of the five primary elements.
Ancestry
Ancestry
Every character belongs to an ancestry, one of the many creatures that exist in Wuxing. The ancestry you choose contributes to your character’s identity in an important way, by establishing a general appearance and the natural talents available to you.

▾ ▸ Skills
Athletics
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Acrobatics (QCK)
Your Acrobatics check covers your attempt to stay on your feet in a tricky situation, such as when you’re trying to run across a sheet of ice, balance on a tightrope, or stay upright on a rocking ship’s deck.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Physique (BOD)
The Physique skill represents a character’s raw strength and endurance. It is used when using physical strength to break through objects and restraints.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Stealth (QCK)
Make a Stealth check when you attempt to conceal yourself from enemies, palm an object, slink past guards, slip away without being noticed, or sneak up on some one without being seen or heard.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Traversal (BOD)
Your traversal check covers movement through an environment such as when climbing, jumping, or swimming.
Creation
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Build (RSN)
Build is the skill to create structures and objects. This skill includes several different forms of artistic impression such as through drawing, sculpting, handcrafting of fine objects, and conveying art and information through images and technique.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Channel (RSN)
Channel is the skill to maintain concentration on ether you have manipulated in order to continue its effects. Magical effects that create a sustained area of effect typically use channel to determine their effectiveness.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Concoct (INT)
Concoct is the skill of combining ingredients inorder to create a new product. If you are cooking a meal, making medicine, or otherwise blending items together to form a new item you would use the mix skill.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Enchant (CNV)
Enchant is the skill to control ones own ether and impart it into another person or object. This is the basis for techniques like healing and empowerment magic.
Sensing
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Analyze (RSN)
When attempting to find clues and make deductions based on those clues, you make an Analyze check. You might deduce the location of a hidden object, discern from the appearance of a wound what kind of weapon dealt it, or determine the weakest point in a tunnel that could cause it to collapse. Poring through books in search of a hidden fragment of knowledge might also call for an Analyze check.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Empathy (INT)
Empathy is used to sense both feelings in other creatures and any existing mana or ether in the environment.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Resonance (CNV)
Resonance is the ability to detect and release ether. It is most often used to detect magical structures and as communication with spirits. Less commonly, it can be used to destroy magical effects and structures made from ether that hasn't been permanently bound.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Search (INT)
This is used to actively search for for clues or anything out of sorts. You might deduce the location of a hidden object, discern from the appearance of a wound what kind of weapon dealt it, or determine the weakest point in a tunnel that could cause it to collapse.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Survival (BOD)
Survival is the ability to stay alive in ex- treme environmental conditions for extended periods of time. The skill governs a character’s ability to per- form vital outdoor tasks such as start a fire, build a shel- ter, scrounge for food, etc.
Social
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Charm (INT)
Enticing, fascinating, and endearing others to you on a personal basis. It can be used to win someone over emotionally through friendliness, joy, and an ability to read a situation.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Command (CNV)
Command is the ability to use perceived authority or intimidation to control another's perceptions and action. One may use command to inspire a companion, intimidate a foe into backing down, or when making demands of another.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Deception (CNV)
Deception is the skill of telling convincing lies, as well as feigning emotion, belief, or frame of mind. Deception can encompass everything from misleading others through ambiguity to telling outright lies. This skill is also used to convince others of a disguise.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Negotiation (RSN)
Negotiation governs a character’s ability to apply their charisma, tactics, and knowledge of situational psychology in order to create a better position when making deals.
Item
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Finesse (QCK)
Finesse is used to strike with light and nimble weapons such as daggers, shortswords, and rapiers. Those that use finesse weapons will often fight deftly, exploiting weaknesses in an enemy's defenses. Weapons in this group are typically easy to hide and allow their wielders to exploit a brace vulnerability. Techniques that support this skill will often grant more mobility options to a character.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Might (BOD)
This skill allows one to attack with brute strength while wielding heavy and cumbersome weapons. These weapons support large damage values allowing their wielders to smash through their enemies. Weapons in this group often will pierce through armor or exploit a reflex vulnerability.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Pilot (QCK)
When attempting to drive a vehicle of any kind, the pilot skill often governs most checks.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Shoot (PRC)
The skill of using a bow or firearm. These weapons have the most variety in weapon ranges allowing one to reliably attack from a distance.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Skirmish (PRC)
This skill governs most balanced, close range fighting styles such as with longswords, clubs, and polearms. Weapons in this category offer the most variety of technique options to manipulate the battlefield to their favor. Unique to this group are weapons that can exploit both reflex and brace vulnerabilities.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Throw (PRC)
When one strikes at a foe or aims for a location by throwing an object, it is typical to use the throw skill. Many melee weapons will have a range increment. In order to use this range the user will instead use the Throw skill to determine accuracy.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Tinker (PRC)
This skill covers building, repairing, and disabling mechanical devices such as locks, tools, and machinery.

Walthair Languages
▾ ▸
Minere - Common
The common language used in Minerva and the lands surrounding it. Minere is made up of three root languages that were once spoken commonly amongst the coastal civilizations of the area.
 
▣ ▢ Speak
 
▣ ▢ Read / Write
▾ ▸
Crinere - Ancient
The ancient language of the civilization of Metis. It has fallen out of favor for the modern Minere and is the basis for said language. Due to how similar the two languages are, many who speak Minere find themselves able to understand the scriptures of Crinere.
 
▣ ▢ Speak
 
▣ ▢ Read / Write
▾ ▸
Palmic - Tropical Seas
This spoken language is used exclusively in tropical island nations. In modern times it only sees common use by tribes in the region, however its language is often used in the tourism industry to imbue a sense of exoticism.
 
▣ ▢ Speak
 
▣ ▢ Read / Write
▾ ▸
Shorespeak - East Sea
A spoken language used by those living along the east coast and in island nations across the sea. While it has no written language, its similarities to both Minere and ancient Vulca make it easy to communicate across cultures regardless.
 
▣ ▢ Speak

▾ ▸
Verdeni - Verdant Key
The spoken language of the island of Verdant Key. Its peoples' isolation from most of modern society has kept this language in tact to ancient times.

▣ ▢ Read / Write
▾ ▸
Vulca - Ancient
The ancient language of the civilization of Vulcan. It shares a lot of common traits of Shorespeak and may be its root language. The language has fallen out of favor for both Minere and Shorespeak but can still be found on ancient, Ocean Court relics and Vulcan texts.

Junal - Common
Juno's major language and the official language of the Guidance. Those who live within or below the city of Juno are expected to learn and speak this language to fully integrate into society.

The dialect of the tribes of people that live in the Baryan Ascent, north of the Aridsha Desert. It has many common traits with the neighboring dialect of Dustell.

▾ ▸
Dustell - Aridsha
This language has many derrivatives across the tribes of the desert. However each version, while distinct in its pronunciations, share a common written form derrived from the Shira language. Due to its use throughout the desert, it is Juno's second most common language.

Muralic - Aridsha
The language of the Murali people in the deserts of Aridsha. Its roots in Shira are clear and may be even closer to the ancient language than Junal.

▣ ▢ Read / Write
▾ ▸
Shira - Ancient
An old language that evolved into both the Junal and Muralic languages. Usage can still be found in ancient Guidance relics.

Khem Languages
▾ ▸
Apollen - Common
The common tongue of Apollo, this language uses a variety of symbols in written works. It is one of the oldest languages still in use in modern times. In the Blessed lands it is known as Mons, the language of the mountainous people, the Monsen.

▾ ▸
Kleikan - Klef
This spoken language was once the language of the Suntouched people that lived west of the Khembalung Mountain range. It's largely fallen out of favor but pockets of people still try to keep the language alive.

Lib - Common
This language is commonly used in Liber. Its roots seem entirely locked to the region, however the age of the language itself are unclear due to it not being used in written form until much later than its equivalents.

The most commonly spoken language in all of Ceres, this language is the original tongue used by the Choi clan. To most in modern times, this connection to the Choi clan is lost but it can often be made clear in the company of those of the clan.

Craftmanship Lore
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ General Craftmanship
The knowledge of creating items through manipulation of substances and materials. A knowledge check here will help one identify techniques used to create an object but not necessarily how to recreate it.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Alchemy
Alchemy is the science of substances and how they can change. When working with chemicals and material that on their own should not be consumed, Alchemy will typically apply. Alchemy is typically used in the creation of drugs and substances.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Architecture
This knowledge represents a general knowledge about building design, general points of entry, and potential weaknesses.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Brewing
Brewing is the skill that governs any kind of skill the requires the mixing of ingredients into a drink or broth.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Cooking
Food is important for survival, so making it enjoyable is a craft of great appreciation. Cooking knowledge gives you the knowledge of different cooking techniques to create meals.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Engineering
Engineering knowledge represents an understanding of mechanisms and systems to build complex structures and items.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Glassblowing
When working with and shaping glass, the skill of glassblowing is required.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Leatherworking
Leatherworking entails any skills related to skinning and using animal skins for clothing, and items.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Sculpting
Sculpting allows one to use soft material like clay and shape it into a desired form.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Smithing
Smithing is the skill that allows you to shape various materials, usually metal, into tools of combat or other larger metalic items.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Weaving
Weaving is the skill for putting together and shaping fabrics and cloths into useful material and objects.

Religion Lore
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ General Religion
Religion knowledge represent known tenets, famous people and creatures of the religion, and information about legends, beliefs, and organizations.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Church of Kongkwei
The Church of Kongkwei is tied to the creation of the Kingdom of Apollo. It follows the fire god Guong Kongkwei and attempts to follow their goals of expansion and control.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Guidance
The Guidance is one of the oldest religions in the world of Wuxing. They seek to give its people advice in times of hardship through the divinations of spirits.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Life's Circle
The Life's Circle is the religion of the Novae. It follows the cycle of life and helps determine a person's role in society through reincarnation and destiny.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Ocean Court
The Ocean Court follows the Ocean Queen, Minerra, and her court of gods that ensure her commandments are followed. Those that revere her and her court do so for her protection and luck whether its in her domain at sea or deep in the lands.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Sylvan
The Sylvans are a group of powerful spirits that hold dominion over territories across the world. They are creatures of whimsy and chaos, the cause of weather patterns and together, the changing of the seasons.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Zushaon
Many Ceresians follow Zushaon, a tradition of ancestor worship. The religion seeks to offer reverence for those that came before and a desire to find ones own place in the world.

▾ ▸ Interceptor
The interceptor is an expert in disrupting others. Prefering weapons with increased threat, interceptors protect their allies by stopping the movement of advancing enemies.
Level
Interceptor Role
Interceptor is a Defender and grants one level of Defender whenever this job is taken.

▾ ▸
Preemptive Strike
Reaction; 1/Round
Traits:
Armament This technique uses the skill, threat and range values of the equipped weapon. Add the weapon's damage to the technique's damage.
Trigger: The target moves within your threat.
Target: One target
Check: Weapon vs. BR Check
You perform a melee attack against the triggering character.
On Hit: The target stops moving immediately and loses any unused movement.

▾ ▸
Savior
Reaction; 1/Round
Trigger: A character adjacent to you is hit by a melee attack.
You trade spaces with the triggering defending character and take the attack instead. The original attack is cancelled and the attacking character is forced to remake the melee attack against you. If the triggering defending character is adjacent to you after the attack, you may trade places with them.

▾ ▸ Scholar
The scholar is an expert in history and uses it to always be prepared. In addition to history, scholars are typically knowledgable in a broad array of subjects and will sometimes use it to educate others. In combat, a scholar will use their preparedness to avoid bad situations and help their allies avoid them too.
Level
Scholar Role
Scholar is a Focus and grants one level of Focus whenever this job is taken.

Scholar Techniques
Job Techniques are learned when reaching the associated level.
Level 1
Job Job - Augment
▾ ▸
Foresight
Reaction; 1/Round
Trigger: Trigger conditions vary.
Your studies have left you with uncanny prescience. When a condition in the following list is met, you may perform the action.
• When you fail a recall knowledge check and used a specialized knowledge, try again.
• When initiative is determined, gain 10 Ki.
• When you are surprised, you may choose to act in the surprise round.
• When an adjacent ally starts their turn, you allow the character to use the Dash technique once for free.
Level 7
Job Job - Augment
▾ ▸
Saw That Coming
Reaction; 1/Round; 2 Ki
You may include the following options:
• When a character becomes engaged with you, you may move half your speed.
• When an adjacent ally is targetted by an attack, you may use the reposition technique on them before the attack occurs. If the ally is not in the attacker's range, the attack automatically misses.
• When an adjacent ally gains a condition, clear the condition.
Level 20
Job Job - Augment
▾ ▸
As You May Recall
Reaction; 1/Day; 1 Chakra
Instead you may declare a flashback scene. The scene cannot be more than 1 minute long and having happened no more than a day's time. The scene may show you having prepared for an outcome. This may come in the form of having purchased/acquired a necessary item or having gathered information related to the present.
This flashback must be possible in accordance to established events. The GM may declare you need to perform a skill check to have the scene occur. The GM is the final arbiter of whether a flashback can be established and what the consequences are.
▾ ▸ Physician
The physician is a medical practitioner and expert healer. Their Emergency Care allows them to heal allies and provide them with barrier, eventually allowing them to heal wounds. And if faster healing is necessary, their First aid allows them to perform healing as a Quick action.
Level
Physician Role
Physician is a Technical and grants one level of Technical whenever this job is taken.

Role Role - Defender
▾ ▸
▣ ▢
Defender's Taunt
Reaction; 1/Round; 1 Ki
Trigger: You successfully attack a character.
Threat: 3
Target: The triggering character
Check: Command vs. Resolve Check
On Hit: The target gains the Angered status against you.
[State: Angered] The character is furious with another character. When this character makes an attack roll and it does not include the character that is the source of their angered condition, they receive +1 disadvantage on the attack roll.

Role Role - Athlete
▾ ▸
▣ ▢
Athlete's Sprint
Swift; 1/Round
You may move up to your speed. During this movement you ignore engagement and your movement does not provoke reactions.
[State: Engaged] If a character moves adjacent to a hostile character, they both gain the Engaged status for as long as they remain adjacent to one another. Ranged attacks made by an Engaged character receive +1 Disadvantage. Additionally, characters that become Engaged by targets of equal or greater Size during the course of a movement stop moving immediately and lose any unused movement.
Role Role - Athlete
▾ ▸
▣ ▢
Athlete's Reach
Free
If your weapon has threat, your threat with the weapon increases by 1.
Role Role - Athlete
▾ ▸
▣ ▢
Bounding Sprint
Swift; 1 Ki
Target: One target
Check: Weapon vs. BR Check
Until the end of your current turn, you ignore engagement, your movement does not provoke reactions, and you may move through enemies' spaces.
[State: Engaged] If a character moves adjacent to a hostile character, they both gain the Engaged status for as long as they remain adjacent to one another. Ranged attacks made by an Engaged character receive +1 Disadvantage. Additionally, characters that become Engaged by targets of equal or greater Size during the course of a movement stop moving immediately and lose any unused movement.

Preemptive Strike
Reaction; 1/Round
Traits:
Armament This technique uses the skill, threat and range values of the equipped weapon. Add the weapon's damage to the technique's damage.
Trigger: The target moves within your threat.
Target: One target
Check: Weapon vs. BR Check
You perform a melee attack against the triggering character.
On Hit: The target stops moving immediately and loses any unused movement.
Job Job - Augment
▾ ▸
▣ ▢
Preemptive Stagger
Reaction; 1 Ki
On Hit: The target gains the Staggered condition.
[Condition: Staggered] Attacks against a staggered target receive +1 Advantage. When a character gains advantage from this status the character loses the Staggered condition. When a round starts, staggered is removed from all characters. Staggered is also required to use some techniques.

Job Job - Augment
▾ ▸
▣ ▢
Savior
Reaction; 1/Round
Trigger: A character adjacent to you is hit by a melee attack.
You trade spaces with the triggering defending character and take the attack instead. The original attack is cancelled and the attacking character is forced to remake the melee attack against you. If the triggering defending character is adjacent to you after the attack, you may trade places with them.
Job Job - Augment
▾ ▸
▣ ▢

Reaction
After trading spaces with the defending character, you may move the character up to 2 spaces in any direction.

Reaction; 1 Ki

Volatile This technique uses volatile ether. When this technique hits a character that projects a barrier, the damage is done twice, first only to temporary HP, the second is treated normally.

Geyser
Full; 2 Ki
Prerequisites: Water Blast Technique
Traits:
Volatile This technique uses volatile ether. When this technique hits a character that projects a barrier, the damage is done twice, first only to temporary HP, the second is treated normally.
Range: 3
Target: One Target
Check: Shoot vs. DB Check
Damage: 3d6 Force [Water]
You cause water to push a target. You may choose to not deal damage with this attack.
On Hit: The target gains the launched status.
[Condition: Launched] The character is thrown into the air. Attacks against a launched target receive +1 Advantage and the creature is moved one extra space whenever they take forced movement. When a character gains advantage from this status the character loses the Launched condition. The creature also loses the Launched condition when they take their turn and at the start of a round.

Camoflauge
Full; 1 Ki
Prerequisites: Path Technique
Traits:
Focus+ Until an end trigger is reached or you stop channeling ki this technique will continue its effects. Unlike Focus effects, a character can only ever maintain one Focus+ effect at a time. When you take Trauma, all on going Focus+ effects immediately end. The caster can end a Focus+ technique at any time.
Material This technique affects material elemental properties. In order to affect a material with this technique, you must have an affinity to all elements of the material. If you do not, a caster that casts the same spell in the same round on the same material who has access to any missing elements may supplement for the use of this technique.
You cover yourself with dust or loose material in the environment. As long as the material could blend in with your environment and you have soft cover, you may take the Hide action.

Break Free
Quick
Threat: 1
Target: One Target
Check: Physique vs. Brace Check
You attempt to end a grapple or restraining effect by breaking the grappler's grip.
[State: Grappled] While a character is grappled, both characters become Engaged, and can't Dash or take reactions for the duration of the grapple.
The character in control of the grapple is the larger creature while the smaller character becomes Immobilized but moves when the controlling party moves, mirroring their movement. If both parties are the same Size, the one that initiated the grapple is in control. Either can make contested Physique checks at the start of their turn: the winner counts as the character in control until this contest is repeated.
A Grapple automatically ends when:
• either character breaks adjacency, such as if they are knocked back by another effect;
• the controller chooses to end the grapple as a free action

Grapple
Quick
Threat: 1
Target: One Target
Check: Physique vs. BR Check
You attempt to grapple a character.
On Hit: Both you and the target gain the grappled status.
[State: Grappled] While a character is grappled, both characters become Engaged, and can't Dash or take reactions for the duration of the grapple.
The character in control of the grapple is the larger creature while the smaller character becomes Immobilized but moves when the controlling party moves, mirroring their movement. If both parties are the same Size, the one that initiated the grapple is in control. • either character breaks adjacency, such as if they are knocked back by another effect;
• the controller chooses to end the grapple as a free action
Standard Standard - Augment
▾ ▸
▣ ▢
Hide
Quick
Traits:
Simple This technique can be used even when under duress such as while under the Downed state.
To Hide, you must not be Engaged and you must either be outside of any enemies’ line of sight, obscured by sufficient cover, or invisible. If you Hide while meeting one of these criteria, you gain the Hidden status.
Hard cover is sufficient to Hide as long as it is large enough to totally conceal you, but soft cover is only sufficient if you are completely inside an area or zone that grants soft cover.
[State: Hidden] Hidden characters can’t be targeted by hostile attacks or actions, don’t cause engagement, and enemies only know their approximate location. Attacking, forcing saves, taking reactions, using Dash, and losing cover all remove Hidden after they resolve. Characters can find Hidden characters with Search.
[State: Engaged] If a character moves adjacent to a hostile character, they both gain the Engaged status for as long as they remain adjacent to one another. Ranged attacks made by an Engaged character receive +1 Disadvantage. Additionally, characters that become Engaged by targets of equal or greater Size during the course of a movement stop moving immediately and lose any unused movement.

Hold Out
Reaction; 1/Rest
Trigger: You take a wound and it would knock you unconscious.
You are not knocked unconscious.
[State: Unconscious] An unconscious creature cannot take actions or reactions, can’t move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
The creature drops whatever it’s holding and falls prone.
The creature automatically fails all saving throws.
Attack rolls against the creature have +1 Advantage.
Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.

Armament This technique uses the skill, threat and range values of the equipped weapon. Add the weapon's damage to the technique's damage.
Threat: Weapon
Target: One target
Check: Weaponvs; BR DC
You perform a melee attack against your ally's target.
Standard Basic
▾ ▸
Grab an Edge
Base Reaction ; 1/Round
Trigger: When you fall off or past an edge or other handhold
Check: Reflex vs. DC 15
You can try to grab the ledge, potentially stopping your fall. You must succeed at a Reflex save.
On Hit: You stop at the edge. If an adjacent space is unoccupied you may immediately climb up and move to the space.
Standard Basic
▾ ▸
Total Defense
Base Reaction ; 1/Round
Trigger: You are hit by an attack and damage has been rolled.
You count as having Resistance to all damage from the triggering attack, and until the end of your next turn, all other attacks against you are made at +1 Disadvantage.
Due to the stress of defending, you cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn and on that turn, you can only take one quick action – you cannot standard move, take full actions, or take free actions.
Heroic Techniques
Standard Hero
▾ ▸
Hold Out
Base Reaction ; 1/Rest
Trigger: You take a wound and it would knock you unconscious.
You are not knocked unconscious.
